headline: Grilled Marinated Shrimp
description: This shrimp marinade makes the best shrimp, especially for grilling. Try this quick and easy recipe that makes the perfect addition to any dish.

video.description: This tangy marinade makes the shrimp both moist and flavorful.
video.name: Grilled Marinated Shrimp

name: Grilled Marinated Shrimp
recipeIngredient: 2 pounds large shrimp, peeled and deveined with tails attached

recipeInstructions.text: Mix together olive oil, parsley, lemon juice, hot pepper sauce, garlic, tomato paste, oregano, salt, and black pepper in a mixing bowl. Reserve a small amount for basting later. Pour remaining marinade into a large resealable plastic bag with shrimp. Seal, and marinate in the refrigerator for 2 hours.
Preheat a grill to medium-low heat. Thread shrimp onto skewers, piercing once near the tail and once near the head. Discard marinade.
Lightly oil grill grate. Cook shrimp until opaque, about 5 minutes per side, basting frequently with reserved marinade.

review.reviewBody: Excellent. Did not add hot sauce because mother-in-law can’t stand spicy. Did the grilled romaine as suggested by another reviewer. All done on the outdoor gas grill in less than 15 minutes. Everyone very happy.

Followed the recipe to a 'T'. After first bite of shrimp, each family member stated recipe was a "keeper"! Excellent and be sure to not overcook and the body pulls right out of the tail shell when eating.
Family favorite.

I had remembered this recipe in my head for years. I bought a few pounds of shrimp and I ended up finding this recipe I used years ago. I marinated the shrimp for 6 hours. I used my gas grill outside on a Scewer and these shrimp turned out excellent. This time around I opted to keep this recipe for future uses. I definitely would recommend this recipe to others.
Made recipe exactly but pressed the garlic instead of minced (was being lazy.) Very good. Only thing I would say is to use only 1/2 the salt. Just a touch too salty.
We both thought this is some of the best shrimp I've ever prepared. No more garlic and olive oil on the grill. This will be my go to recipe!

This recipe is amazing. I have used it several times and never changed the recipe… it doesn’t disappoint 
Thanks for sharing
Amazingly delicious!!!

This was a huge hit. I made a cold pasta salad to go with it with grilled zucchini and squash, pappardelle, fresh basil, parsley and Marietta Olive oil and vinegar dressing. The shrimp was marinated for 2 hours and that was just right. This would be great to take/make as an appetizer to a party.

The shrimp was amazing! Made some changes-- this "review" is really just notes for me so I can recreate it: Only used 1/2 cup EVOO, didn't have a lemon so used about 1/3 c lemon juice, no parsley so used cilantro, no hot sauce or tomato paste so used "Go Chicken Go" (reg TM) sauce which is like a spicy shrimp cocktail sauce, left out the oregano just out of laziness. Had this on the grill 4th of July-- my teen boys and their friends all said it was "fire!"
Easy and delicious!
This was a really good marinade recipe, but I used jumbo shrimp and cooked them 3 minutes each side on the grill. 5 minutes each side would have ruined them!

This marinade makes absolutely the best tasting shrimp. My husband said it tasted even better than a restaurant's and we are going to use it as a weekly meal from now on. I used cayenne instead of hot pepper sauce and a little dried parsley, with my fresh parsley instead of oregano because I didn't have any on hand. We sautéd the shrimp on the stove and made tacos. Super good.
This recipe was easy and delicious!

This is one of my favorites grilled shrimp marinades! A little heat, good seasoning! Yum!! I have made several times - sometimes I pre-peel the shrimp, others I marinade with shell still on. I prefer the latter; I feel like the EZ Peel holds the flavor in more. But! For shellfish newbies; the idea of peeling the shrimp...not for everyone so I do it based on whether I’m serving me and my husband or have a pickier guests. (Also depends on kind of event). Either way; this is one of my go-to’s when grilling season starts and I have a hankering for shrimp! Thank you!

My husband is the shrimp eater in the family. He gives this 5 stars. I have to make it every time we go to a dinner party or have guests over. He raves about it. for the non seafood eaters it is good on chicken as well.
It has a kick, but i made it three times so far. Family loves it.

Followed the recipe to the letter. Was worried about the amount of hot sauce at first since my wife doesn't like spicy food, but trusted other reviews that said you could hardly taste it. I'm glad I did. It was just enough to put it over the top.
I made this as per the recipe and agree with everyone here. And decided sourdough girl's suggestion to grill the romaine sounded too good not to try. It was amazing! Thanks for that tip!
it was great!
Best grilled shrimp ever!! This is a definite must try. Perfect on a salad or with grilled steak tips!
Excellent! I added lemon zest from the juiced lemon.

Everyone loved this Shrimp dish, and it was easy to make and delicious. I did have to eliminate the garlic, but I subsubstitued shallot instead. I broiled the shrimp on skewers and it all turned out great. Love it!

Amazing. This was our go-to grill favorite this summer. Go for the jumbo shrimp, but works well with large shrimp, too. I let it marinade about 8 hours. Friends have insisted on getting the recipe, too.
really enjoyed it. made it with 1/2 spice level and it was too soft, next time will use full spices. nice balance. served with spinach, rice, feta.
I removed some ingredients like the tomato sauce and the oregano and replace with cayenne flakes. Also I added a bit more lemon juice than the recipe says and the result was delicious.

I have now made this recipe many times over the last few years. Only once did I add all the ingredients into a ziplock with the shrimp and then mixed it up. This made the shrimp very lemony. Now I mix all the ingredients into a large mason jar and shake like crazy then pour over the shrimp in a ziplock to marinate. Made it one time with lime juice and it wasn't bad but lemon is better.

This is the most used recipe in my kitchen in the last 6 months. Rain or shine, I’m grilling. This is so good I have prepared it weekly. We eat this shrimp like popcorn, in omelets, on PoBoys toasted and fully dressed, on noodles as scampi, snacks for midday etc. I generally do 3lb of large shrimp on this recipe for 2 people. I use ketchup instead of tomato paste and I double the amount of garlic. The spice is nice and my preference is Louisiana Hot Sauce. Sooo Good my mouth waters just thinking about those shrimp.
Really enjoyed this recipe for grilled shrimp. It’s great trying something different & being delighted you did. Will make this again.

Excellent and so easy!! I followed all directions except used dried parsley because I didn’t have fresh. My husband forgot to baste them with the extra marinade, but it didn’t matter because the shrimp was still super flavorful and delicious. I served some nice and warm right off the grill as an app. The others I threw into a simple summer salad of romaine, arugula, shaved Parm, and lemon vinaigrette. Can’t wait to make again!
Delicious! I got lots of compliments on the shrimp!

I followed the recipe exactly as written, except I doubled it, and I'm glad I did! Not only was it delicious with shrimp, but we also marinated chicken with it. Both were spectacular. I also marinated some zucchini, onions, and cauliflower in it and that went on the grill as well. I made some chickpea pasta and mixed it with sauteed onions and peppers and the remaining marinade, and ended up throwing the grilled vegetables into the saute pan to marry it all together. Just wonderful! And hats off to the reviewer who had the idea to spoon out tablespoons of the tomato paste onto waxed paper and freeze. I only had a big can of paste, and I was glad to not have it go to waste. This was a wonderful recipe that we will be using often!
Very yummy! A nice flavorful change from the usual garlic and lemon flavors!
Good easy recipe but way too salty for my taste. Personally I would nix the 1 teaspoon of salt and add a pinch of salt at the end if you need to.
Made it as written and even my meh prawn eater loved it! Will definitely be making it again!!
Wife and I loved it! Made a few minor changes - didn't have any tomato paste on hand so I used ketchup and I used a perforated grill skillet instead of skewers to put them on the grill.
Delicious! Perfect as written. Don’t change the recipe and then give it 4 stars because your changes suck.
Taste was great. Easy to prepare.
Awesome. No changes. Marinated in frig for 3 hours. Skewer with some zucchini served with angel hair pasta with sun dried tomatoes and spinach. Flavor was great.

The hot sauce adds a nice kick! Buy the tomato paste in a tube for recipes like this. Instead of basting I used the extra to sauté tomatoes, added grilled asparagus and pasta with the shrimp. It was fantastic!
As per the instructions....excellent
Did not use pepper flakes because of my wife. Think it would have been much better with spiciness
Made as is, except I left out the hot sauce. I also used a Tupperware container to marinate it. This is the BEST grilled shrimp I've ever had...including from restaurants. HIGHLY recommend.

This recipe is a keeper. I followed the recipe minus the tomato paste (didn't have any) and used only 12 large shrimp with the same amount of marinade which I used for basting and leftover Aglio y Olio. It was delicious! I'll make this again and again. 
Thanks Robbie!
This recipe was wonderful! I didn't grill the shrimp because I didn't have any skewers, so I baked them in the marinade at 400 for 11 minutes.

I’ve made it several times. I got tired of throwing away so much olive oil. I made two changes. Half cup of oil. Then use immersion blender. Marinate in gallon ziplock. Don’t need to baste. Careful not to overcook.
Amazing flavor! Will definitely make it again!
Amazing!!!!!! Took another’s suggestion and reserved 1/2 the marinade and poured over Romain lettuce then grilled each side. Laid the shrimp over it too and it was a meal! Must make all summer!
Best shrimp marinade ever!
Very Simple and turned out well. Will make again with a bit more spice, but guests asked for the recipe.
Perfection. Next time I'll make more.

This recipe is a big favorite. As my sister put it, “If this were a meal at a restaurant, I would order it every time I went there, and recommend it to everybody.” Despite being easy to prepare, it makes the chef look like some kind of genius, and best of all, it doesn’t need to sit in the marinade longer than a few minutes to get the flavor. I spend more time threading the shrimp onto kebabs then anything else.It really enhances the flavor of the shrimp without masking it.
This was the best BBQ Shrimp I've ever made! Will be a favorite for sure!
This was a very simple and mild seasoning for the shrimp. It was a crowd pleaser. I used the left overs for a shrimp salad and it worked perfectly.

I made this right away. I added 1/4 cup of freshly chopped cilantro and the juice of one fresh lime to the original recipe and, WOW, everyone loved it! This will be my go-to shrimp recipe from now on!
I wouldn't change a thing. This is a yummy recipe served with coconut rice, steamed broccoli and sliced avocado.
LOVED THIS! The perfect meal over couscous with a side of oven-roasted asparagus. I, too, swapped the hot pepper sauce for sriracha. Amazing. Just make it
I was not happy with this recipe at all. I am surprised it got 5 stars, Won't make again.
Absolutely amazing!!!!

This was delicious! I needed a simple quick recipe to make dinner tonight and this was the perfect choice. My oldest who can be quite picky couldn’t stop eating this! We didn’t feel like getting the grill ready since it was a late dinner, so I just tossed them in my cast iron skillet and they were delish! Thanks so much!

I had a taste for grilled shrimp and found thus recipe in Allrecipes. This was the main part of my Mother’s Day dinner and it was deeeeelicious. We had three skewers left over and put them in the fridge. They were just as good as leftovers. I will definitely follow this recipe again. Five stars
Did half a cup of olive oil. Added a little sugar since it was pretty sour but very tasty recipe overall!
Best shrimp recipe ever

This is a go to shrimp recipe for me. I have been making it for years and everyone always raves about it! Best grilled shrimp recipe on the internet. I like mine a little spicier so I had more hot sauce.
This receipe worked well. I added peppers on the skewers to make the dish look more inviting.
Best kabob I’ve ever had. I actually substituted strawberry jam (closest substitute on hand) for tomato paste and used Tabasco for the hot sauce.

Terrific Recipe! I used sriracha as the hot sauce and it was great for us. If you want hotter you can modify it to your tastes although it was perfect for us. The only thing I substituted was a vegetable oil for olive oil as it goes solid when in the fridge. Definitely a keeper.

Absolutely delicious. I didn't have lemon so I used lime instead. And I don't grill so I just drained the marinade and pan dried. Also only had 30 mins to let it marinate in the fridge. Still amazing. This will definitely be a go-to for seasoning shrimp in the future!
Best grilled shrimp ever. You have to try it!
Was very tasty! I like my food hot so I added ghost pepper sauce and did not use tomatoe....delicious!
Hands down the best shrimp marinade.!
Excellent flavors! I’ll definitely make it again

I made this for a group event of about 40 people. Everyone raved about this recipe. At least 5 men specifically came up to me and said this is the best shrimp they have ever ate. 
I did make 15 pounds of shrimp so I made 7 times the amount. I marinated the shrimp for 2 hours and didn't add the lemon juice till 30 minutes before. But I agree with many here. The Lemon juice starts "cooking" the ends of the shrimp and created a gummy coating. Again everyone loved it though. I will only marinade it for 30-45 minutes next time and add the lemon about 5-10 minutes before grilling. We put the veggies on separate skewers from the shrimp which worked really well.
This has lots of flavor without over powering the shrimp!

Family really liked this, without the oil . I oiled the grill and used a fresh Italian Herb Blend at a Tablespoon vs. the parsley . Served with Chef Johns Big FAT Greek Salad and orzo with parmesan from this site. Family said "Again please "

The grill wasn't working, so I cooked it on 450 degrees for 6 minutes, following by a few minutes under the broiler. Came out great! I had already put the shrimp on skewers, so I used a 9 x 12 Pyrex baking dish as a rack. No need to turn them over.
This recipe was delish. Will make this again and again!
This my go to for unbeatable shrimp! I have made extra marinade added a bit more tomato paste, reduced down, and use over noodles for a delicious shrimp & pasta dish.

Hubby and I were looking for something yummy to cook shrimp in our air fryer. I didn't have much time to marinade the shrimp, probably gave it about 20 minutes, so I doubled the garlic, lemon, salt, pepper, and Cholula. This was SO FREAKING GOOD that I pulled out more shrimp and we're making more for later. I didn't have tomato paste, parsley, or oregano so we made this more of a lemon pepper shrimp. Thank you for sharing such a fantastic recipe!!
Not changes and it is family favorite. Easy to make. And make ahead of time. Excellent recipe!
Wonderful! Made 1/2 the recipe. Grilled on an indoor griddler cause well it’s winter. Did not skewerer. Can’t wait to throw these puppies on the outdoor grill this summer.

This recipe is spot on. So simple yet soooo good! Really good. Like if I’m on death row and I need to request my last meal good. I was surprised by the simple ingredients but was even more surprised at how delicious it turned out. I followed the recipe to a T. Irks me when people review a recipe and say how great it is “with a few of my awesome changes to it”. Follow this recipe as is. You will not be disappointed. This is a definite keeper.
my husband and I really loved this so we added it to our recipes and tried it on fish. AMAZING!!

This is really a great recipe. I have used it dozens of times and served it at parties. A bunch of fresh basil is what makes it stand out. I don’t recommend any other method besides grilling for this. Goes great with salad.
This is great. I added it to my shrimp recipes. I did use ketchup as recommended by another reviewer and baked them in the oven. Delicious. I served it over fettuccine. It's easy and good.
Easy and thinking of trying it with chicken!

My family loves this recipe. I have made it as written and with only half the red pepper as I have someone whose tolerance of spice is variable as he undergoes chemo. It is still spicy! Also, I hate dealing with skewers so I just put all the shrimp on one of those vegetable/fish grill pans and sauce over the fire. Works very well.

My family loves this recipe. I have made it as written and with only half the red pepper as I have someone whose tolerance of spice is variable as he undergoes chemo. It is still spicy! Also, I hate dealing with skewers so I just put all the shrimp on one of those vegetable/fish grill pans and sauce over the fire. Works very well.

Reduced the amounts due to fewer shrimp. Cooked shrimp in wok with white onion and cherry tomatoes (sweated onion/tomato removed then combined with cooked shrimp). Put mixture on bed of rice noodles. Very tasty. Great marinade!
Added 1 tbsp brown sugar. Give it a sweet sour taste. Good
These were amazing!

This was great!! I only added half the amount of hot pepper sauce because I wasn't sure how spicy it would be and it was perfect. Served it on a bed of rice. Cooked on the George Foreman grill for 5 min.
Used mild habinero sause, because of wife`s preference. Very tasty shrimp. Used butter and grated Romano on spagetti.

OOOO-yeah. We've never been shrimp eaters, but this recipe, along with being able to grill outside (it's HOT where we live in So Cal) are opening us to a whole new direction for our menus! I followed it exactly on a package of thawed, raw jumbo shrimp, marinating it for about 4 hours, flipping it (in the fridge) about 3 times. I halved the recipe and used one pound shrimp (won't anymore...LOL), skewered them up (one pound with 10 on each skewer gave us 4 or 5 skewers), and they grilled up in only a few minutes. Total keeper recipe, and one to repeat hummm...about 100xs a summer :). You can ALWAYS find ways to use already-grilled, leftover shrimp!!!
This recipe delivered on flavor. It was so simple yet so delicious. My small family of four devoured all two pounds of the shrimp skewers in one sitting and still, I found myself wanting more. ??

I have made this recipe dozens of times since 2007 when I first printed it. I still believe only 1/4 to 1/2 cup of oil is plenty. And I don't bother to brush the shrimp with any reserved marinade. It cooks so quickly (usually 3 minutes per side) and the concentrated marinade, by using less oil in the marinade, gives it plenty of flavor. Many times I have marinated the shrimp only a few minutes and still get great results. One of my favorite recipes for entertaining.

I made it and it was amazing! Will make for friends next time!

New go to Shrimp Dish!
Didnt change a thing and everyone loved it. Kudos to the OP.

I agree with everyone’s comments, this dish is absolutely amazing. Great mix of flavors and super easy to make. Followed the recipe almost exactly, sans not measuring a few ingredients perfectly and adding a some dashes of cayenne. Also followed another commenters suggestion and added in some lemon zest. Will definitely make again.
